Definition: A set of ordered steps for processing and analyzing data, possibly mixing custom scripts and third-party tools, where the output of one step is the input of the next step(s)
Another word for workflow; a series of steps where the output of one is the input for the next
Software that allows one to script workflows and helps organize, execute, and monitor all the steps in a workflow automatically
A workflow management tool based on the Python programming language for creating and running workflows, often used in scientific research or data analysis
A workflow management tool based on the Java-based Groovy language, used to create and run data analysis pipelines, especially in bioinformatics, on local computers, clusters, or the cloud
A diagram that shows how steps in a workflow depend on one another
A diagram that shows how each individual file in a workflow depends on the other files in the workflow
An individual step in a workflow
The computational process spawned from any invocation of a rule
The file(s) required for a given rule to run; rules may have one or more inputs
The file(s) produced by a given rule for a single set of input file(s)
A file that stores information related to a given run of a rule that is not the direct output of the rule
